page.title: 03EDUCATION YARMOUTH SCHOOL
page.content: Yarmouth School is a national school that was built in 1855. The land was given by Catherine Leigh and the church raised some money for the school to be built. The first head master was Mr Spray.The school is 13o yrs old. Ten years ago our school was remodelled to provide a hall and extra toilets,it was dedicated by Bishop John of Portsmouth on 4.5.74.We are a Church of England voluntary-aided primary school catering for all boys and girls between 4.5 and 9 years old in our catchment area;and also for the children of practising C.E.members. Our area extends from the top of Halletts Shute to Hill Place Lane and includes Thorley. We can accommodate 60 children but at present have 38 on roll with an annual intake of approx 7 We have a staff of 2.5 and the school is divided into two classes.
